Tables Package

Aggregated Values Module

class AggregatedValue(id, segment, count, type, aggregation, value, direction)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of an Aggregated Value.

Parameters

  • id (int) – The id of the aggregated value.

  • segment (Segment) – Segment to which the aggregated value pertains

  • count (int) – Number of values that have been used to compute the aggregated value

  • type (ComputedValueType) – The type of the data that has been used to compute the aggregated value

  • aggregation (AggregationMethod) – Aggregation method used to compute the aggregated value.

  • direction (int) – Direction of the car related to the aggregated value

  • value (float) – The value of the aggregated value

get_db_row()

Returns a list of values to be inserted in the visualization database as an Aggregated Value

class AggregatedValues(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of the AggregatedValues table. It stores the aggregated values that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

compute_data(computed_ways: List[int], not_computed_ways: List[int])

Computes, creates and stores Aggregated Value objects in the class instance based on the ways passed as parameters.

Parameters

  • computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways whose aggregated values need to be updated in the database instead of inserted.

  • not_computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways whose aggregated values need to be inserted in the database.

drop()

Deletes all the data stored in the class instance.

insert_into_db()

Inserts the aggregated values into the AggregatedValues table in the visualization database.

update_values_in_db()

Updates the aggregated values into the AggregatedValues table in the visualization database.

get_data_type_classes()

Returns the subclasses that implement the different computed values types in the pipeline.

get_aggregation_type_classes()

Returns the subclasses that implement the different aggregation methods in the pipeline.

generate_aggregated_values(ways: List[int]) → List[AggregatedValue]

Returns the aggregated values for a list of ways.

Param

ways: Ways to compute the aggregated values for.

Aggregation Methods Module

class AggregationMethod(id)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of an Aggregation Method.

Parameters

  • id (int) – The id of the Aggregation Method

  • name (str) – Name of the Aggregation Method

  • description (str) – Description of the Aggregation Method

calculate_value(values)

Returns the result of applying the aggregation method to a set of values. This method needs to be overridden by any subclass that implements a type of computed value.

Parameters

values (List[float]) – List of values to aggregate.

get_db_row()

Returns a list of values to be inserted in the visualization database as an Aggregation Method

class AggregationMethods(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of the SegmentsProperties table. It stores the segment properties that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

compute_data()

Computes, creates and stores Aggregation Methods objects in the class instance based on the subclasses implemented in the pipeline as AggregationMethod classes.

drop()

Deletes all the data stored in the class instance.

get_inserted() → List[int]

Returns the ids of the aggregation methods that are already in the visualization database.

insert_into_db()

Inserts the Aggregation Methods into the AggregationMethods table in the visualization database.

get_aggregation_methods_classes()

Returns the AggregationMethod subclasses that implement the different aggregation methods in the pipeline.

generate_aggregation_methods() → List[AggregationMethod]

Returns the Aggregation Methods implemented in the pipeline.

get_aggregation_methods() → List[AggregationMethod]

Returns all AggregationMethods in the pipeline

get_method_by_name(name: str) → AggregationMethod

Returns the AggregationMethod with the name equal to the name passed as parameter.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of the Aggregation Method

Computed Values Module

class ComputedValue(id, measurement, type, value, segment, direction)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of a Computed Value.

Parameters

  • id (int) – The id of the Computed Value.

  • measurement (Measurement) – Measurement from which the Computed Value was computed.

  • segment (Segment) – Segment to which the computed value pertains

  • direction (int) – Direction of the car related to the computed value

  • type (ComputedValueType) – The id of the type of computed value

  • value (float) – The value of the Computed Value

get_db_row()

Returns a list of values to be inserted in the visualization database as a Computed Value

calculate_value(measurement)

Returns the value of the computed value. This method needs to be overridden by any subclass that implements a type of computed value.

Parameters

measurement (Measurement) – The measurement associated with the computed value

static prerequisites(self, measurement)

Returns a boolean indicating if a computed value needs to be computed for a certain measurement. It is used as a filter to avoid computing all types of computed values for all measurements when it is not needed.

Parameters

measurement (Measurement) – Measurement associated with the Computed Value

parse_computed_values(computed_values_rows: List) → List[ComputedValue]

Converts computed values rows retrieved from the database to ComputedValue objects to be used within the pipeline

Parameters

segment_rows (List[]) – A list of lists of values representing ComputedValue objects

class ComputedValues(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of the Computed Values table. It stores the computed values that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

compute_data(measurements, computed_ways)

Computes, creates and stores Computed Value objects in the class instance based on the ways and measurements passed as parameters.

Parameters

  • measurements (List[Measurement]) – Measurements from which the function computes the ComputedValues

  • computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways whose Computed Values need to be retrieved from the database instead of computed.

drop()

Deletes all the data stored in the class instance.

insert_into_db()

Inserts the Computed Values into the ComputedValues table in the visualization database.

compute_dictionaries()

Computes dictionaries that store the computed values. The purpose of the dictionaries is for computed values to be accessed and searched in a most efficient way.

get_computed_values_types_classes()

Returns the subclasses that implement the different computed values types in the pipeline.

generate_computed_values(measurements: List[Measurement]) → List[ComputedValue]

Returns the computed values for a list of measurements.

Param

measurements: Measurements from which to compute the Computed Values.

get_computed_values_in_segment(segment_id) → List[ComputedValue]

Returns the computed values in a segment.

Param

segment_id: Id of the segment.

  • units (str) – Describes the units of the Computed Value

This is a conceptual class representation of the ComputedValuesTypes table. It stores the Computed Values Types that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

Computes, creates and stores Computed Value Type objects in the class instance based on the subclasses implemented in the pipeline as ComputedValue classes.

drop()

Returns the ids of the computed value types that are already in the visualization database.

get_computed_values_types_classes()

Returns the ComputedValue subclasses that implement the different computed values types in the pipeline.

generate_ids(list_modules: List[str]) → List[int]

Returns a list of unique ids for a list of Computed Value Types.

Parameters

list_modules (List[str]) – Names of the modules that contain the implementations of the ComputedValue subclasses.

generate_computed_values_types() → List[ComputedValueType]

Returns the Computed Value Types implemented in the pipeline.

get_id_of_name(name: str) → int

Returns id of a Computed Value Type with the name equal to the name passed as a parameter.

Param

name: Name of the Computed Value Type

get_type_by_id(id: int) → ComputedValueType

Returns a Computed Value Type with the id equal to the id passed as a parameter.

Param

id: Id of the Computed Value Type

get_type_by_name(name: str) → ComputedValueType

Returns a Computed Value Type with the name equal to the name passed as a parameter.

Param

name: Name of the Computed Value Type

Measurements Module

class Measurement(id, type, position, value, trip, created_at, updated_at, segment)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of a car sensor measurement.

Parameters

  • id (str) – The id of the measurement.

  • type (str) – Type of the measurement. Ex: obd.trac_cons.

  • position (List[float]) – Position (latitude and longitude) of measurement.

  • value (float) – Value of the measurement.

  • trip (str) – Id of the trip to which the measurement pertains

  • created_at (str) – Timestamp of when was the measurement measured.

  • updated_at (str) – Timestamp of when was the measurement updated in the LiRA database.

  • segment (Segment) – Segment to which the measurement pertains.

  • direction (int) – Direction in which the car was going at the time of the measure.

  • way (int) – Id of the way to which the measurement pertains.

get_db_row()

Returns a list of values to be inserted in the visualization database as a Measurement

filter_measurements(measurements: List)

Reduces the amount of measurements to compute

Parameters

measurements (List[]) – Original list of measurements to compute

format_for_map_matching(measurements: List[Measurement]) → List

Returns a list of measurements ready for map matching based on the measurements passed as a parameter.

Parameters

measurements (List[Measurement]) – List of measurements to format.

format_3d_measurement(measurement: List, type: str)

Returns three formatted measurements, one for each dimension. Just for measurements which have 3 dimensions such as acceleration (acc.xyz) :param measurement: List of values representing a measurement :type measurement: List[]

format_2d_measurement(measurement: List, type: str)

Returns a formatted measurement. Just for measurements which have 1 dimensions such as power consumption (obd.trac_cons) :param measurement: List of values representing a measurement :type measurement: List[]

format_measurements(measurements: List)

Takes measurements that have been retrieved from the LiRA database and formats them into Measurement class instances. :param measurement: List of measurements :type measurement: List[]

parse_measurements(measurements_rows: List) → List[Measurement]

Takes measurements that have been retrieved from the visualization database and formats them into Measurement class instances. :param measurement: List of measurements :type measurement: List[]

class Measurements(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of the Measurements table. It stores the measurements that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

compute_data(measurements: List[Measurement])

Assigns a segment and a direction to each measurement passed as parameter. Afterwards it stores them as a list and dictionaries in the class instance.

Parameters

measurements (List[Measurement]) – Measurements that need to be assigned to a segment.

drop()

Deletes all the data stored in the class instance.

insert_into_db()

Inserts the Measurements into the Measurements table in the visualization database.

generate_dictionaries(computed_measurements: List[Measurement])

Computes dictionaries that store the measurements. The purpose of the dictionaries is for measurements to be accessed and searched in a most efficient way.

Parameters

computed_measurements – Measurements to be inserted into the dictionaries.

compute_directions()

Computes the directions for the measurements stored in the class instance. Direction refers to the direction of the car when the measurement was taken.

get_measurement_by_id(measurement_id: str) → Measurement

Returns the Measurement that is identified by a certain id.

Parameters

measurement_id (str) – Id of the measurement

get_closest_measurement_of_type_in_segment(type: str, created_at, segment_id: int)

Returns the measurement with the closest timestamp to another timestamp of a measurement of a certain type and a certain segment.

Parameters

  • type (str) – Type of the measurement

  • created_at (str) – Timestamp of reference

  • segment_id (int) – Id of the segment of reference

get_measurements() → List[Measurement]

Returns all the measurements stored in the instance of the class.

calculate_distance(point_a, point_b)

Returns the distance in kilometers between two geographical points.

Parameters

  • point_a (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of the first geographical point.

  • point_b (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of the second geographical point.

is_point_c_between_a_and_b(point_a, point_b, point_c)

Returns if a geographical point C is between a geographical point A and a geographical point B.

Parameters

  • point_a (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of point A.

  • point_b (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of point B.

  • point_c (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of point C.

compute_measurement(measurement: Measurement, segments: List[Segment]) → int

Assigns a segment to a measurement.

Parameters

  • measurement (Measurement) – Measurement that needs a segment to be assigned to it.

  • segments (List[Segment]) – Candidate segments for assigning the measurement to.

compute_measurements(measurements: List[Measurement]) → List[Measurement]

Assigns segments to a list of measurements.

Parameters

measurements (List[Measurement]) – Measurements that need a segment to be assigned to them.

Segments Module

class Segment(id, position_a, position_b, length, way_id)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of a Segment.

Parameters

  • id (int) – The id of the Segment.

  • position_a (List[float]) – Position (latitude and longitude) of the first node of the Segment.

  • position_b (List[float]) – Position (latitude and longitude) of the second node of the Segment.

  • length (float) – Length of the Segment in kilometers.

  • way_id (int) – Id of the way to which the Segment pertains

get_db_row() → List

Returns a list of values to be inserted in the visualization database as a Segment

parse_segments(segment_rows: List) → List[Segment]

Converts segment rows retrieved from the database to segment objects to be used within the pipeline

param segment_rows

A list of values representing a Segment object

type segment_rows

List[]

class Segments(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of the Segments table. It stores the segments that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

compute_data(computed_ways: List[int], not_computed_ways: List[int])

Computes, creates and stores Segment objects in the class instance based on the ways passed as parameters.

Parameters

  • computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways whose segments need to be retrieved from the database instead of computed.

  • not_computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways that have never been computed and whose segments need to be inserted in the visualization database.

drop()

Deletes all the data stored in the class instance.

insert_into_db()

Inserts the Segments into the Segments table in the visualization database.

generate_dictionaries(computed_segments: List[Segment])

Computes dictionaries that store the segments. The purpose of the dictionaries is for segments to be accessed and searched in a most efficient way.

Parameters

computed_segments (List[Segment]) – Segments to be inserted into the dictionaries.

get_segments_in_a_way(way_id: int) → List[Segment]

Returns all Segments that pertain to a certain way

Parameters

way_id (List[Segment]) – Way id of the way to which the segments must pertain.

get_segments_by_id(seg_id: int) → Segment

Returns the Segment that is identified by a certain id.

Parameters

seg_id (int) – Id of the segment

calculate_distance(point_a, point_b)

Returns the distance in kilometers between two geographical points.

Parameters

  • point_a (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of the first geographical point.

  • point_b (List[float]) – Latitude and longitude of the second geographical point.

generate_id(way: Way, node_a: Node, node_b: Node) → int

Generates a unique id based on the attributes of a segment

Parameters

  • way (:class Way) – Way to which the segment pertains.

  • node_a (:class Node) – First node of the segment.

  • node_b (:class Node) – Second node of the segment.

compute_way(way: Way) → List[Segment]

Returns the computed segments for a certain way

Param

way: Way to be computed.

compute_ways_and_generate_segments(way_ids: List[int]) → List[Segment]

Returns the computed segments for a list of way ids.

Param

way_ids: Ids of the ways to be computed.

Segments Properties Module

class SegmentProperty(id, segment, type=None, value=None)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of a Segment Property.

Parameters

  • id (int) – The id of the Segment Property.

  • segment (Segment) – Segment associated with the Segment Property

  • type (str) – Type of segment property

  • value (float) – Value of the segment property.

calculate_value(segment)

Returns the value for the segment property. This method needs to be overridden by any subclass that implements a segment property.

Parameters

segment (Segment) – The segment associated with the segment property

get_db_row()

Returns a list of values to be inserted in the visualization database as a Segment Property

parse_segment_properties(segment_properties_rows: List) → List[SegmentProperty]

Converts segment property rows retrieved from the database to segment property objects to be used within the pipeline

Parameters

segment_rows (List[SegmentProperty]) – A list of lists of values representing Segment Properties

class SegmentsProperties(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of the SegmentsProperties table. It stores the segment properties that are used during data processing in the pipeline and allows the access to them in an efficient way. It is programmed as a Singleton so one instance exists at the same time and so it can be accessed from any point in the pipeline.

compute_data(computed_ways: List[int], not_computed_ways: List[int])

Computes, creates and stores Segment Property objects in the class instance based on the ways passed as parameters.

Parameters

  • computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways whose segments properties need to be retrieved from the database instead of computed.

  • not_computed_ways (List[int]) – Ways that have never been computed and whose segment properties need to be inserted in the visualization database.

drop()

Deletes all the data stored in the class instance.

insert_into_db()

Inserts the Segment Properties into the SegmentProperties table in the visualization database.

get_segments_properties_types_classes()

Returns the subclasses that implement the different segment properties in the pipeline.

generate_segments_properties(ways_to_compute: List[int]) → List[SegmentProperty]

Returns the segment properties for the segments in the ways passed as parameter.

Parameters

ways_to_compute (List[int]) – Ids of the ways that need their segment properties need to be computed

get_segment_property(property_name: str, segment_id: int) → float

Returns a segment property of a segment

Parameters

  • property_name (str) – Name of the segment property

  • segment_id (int) – Id of the segment
